results.title: Student participation
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
A look at various aspects of student participation in a number of different primary schools in Victoria. Covers curriculum decision-making in the classroom, students running school assemblies, writing school rules and regional meetings of school leaders.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: I like maths
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Introduces three teachers from Corio West Primary School who have developed a series of mathematical “games” to make mathematics more relevant to real-life situations.

results.title: How do you spell my name in chinese?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Piri White, co-editor of “Chalkface” explores a way of introducing a language, in this case Chinese, to a primary school class.

results.title: Art maps
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Chalkface co-editor, Piri White, introduces the work of teachers and students at Richmond Primary School in linking art across the curriculum. The theme of the program is “monsters and things are not always what they seem”

results.title: A Trip to Mexico: an integrated approach
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
An enthusiastic approach to integrated curriculum at Southvale Primary School. A program full of ideas where the subject areas are integrated into a complex unit of work based on a trip to China and Mexico.

results.title: The Devil's playground (1928)
results.creator_credit: Victor Bindley and Fineart Films Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reel Australia”.
Somewhere in the South Seas, a beautiful island has become notorious for the “fetish and cannibal rites” of the natives and the “wild doings” of the white population. The native chief, Trelua, leads an insurrection against the whites because of the degradation that his people have suffered since the arrival of the whiteman. A British cruiser comes to the rescue and the native rebellion is quelled, but not before the main white oppressor is killed.

results.title: The Breaking of the drought
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reel Australia”.
When the outback station of Wallaby is gripped by drought, the proud old owner, Jo Galloway, can do nothing to prevent the repossession of his land by the bank. In poverty, he moves to the city with his wife and daughter, to stay with his son Gilbert, only to learn that Gilbert has been embezzling the family funds to lead a life of luxury and decadence. Many melodramatic events follow, including a murder and a suicide, before the family can return, reunited, to the station, and the rain starts to fall once more.
